website_summaries.verdict: Long and skinny reacher that provides access to tight spaces without being too heavy.
pros: Lightweight, made from aluminum and plastic
Grip area is comfortable and easy to hold to avoid hand cramps
Jaw will turn 90 degrees so you can reach into oddly-shaped spaces
cons: Components inside the grabber may not last over multiple uses

website_summaries.verdict: We highly recommend this extension grabber to users with limited grip strength, as well as those who have a wider range of reaching needs throughout the day, from indoors to outdoors.
pros: Ribbed rubberized tips grip objects securely
Internal mechanism uses metal cable, not nylon or cotton rope
Ergonomic grip does not require much hand strength
cons: Tendency to snap between head and handle
Jaw opening is only 3 1/2" wide, which limits usefulness

customer_reviews.title: Jaws do not align when closed
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping for this product's premium cost that the jaws would at least align when closed. As can be seen in the photos I provided they do not. This misalignment doesn't appear to be adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: kapzy

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 4 weeks.
customer_reviews.text: Product worked fine for about 4 weeks of use. Liked the ability to rotate the head, grippers were good for a lot of things. One day just stopped working and isn’t easy to take apart to fix. Dead after 4 weeks not good enough. Going to go with a different brand. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: DanK

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It catches even the small things it has saved me from a lot of bending overs.UPDATING my review 6 months later,my grip grabber gave up after 6 months of exclusive usage,due to that fact I am taking off two stars!updating my review again after exactly 20 days the second grip grabber broke with gentle use!
customer_reviews.author: meri meri

customer_reviews.title: Not the Quality They Used to Be
customer_reviews.text: We originally bought three of these to place around the house. They worked great with daily use for three years, but two recently broke (the third is still going strong). Six weeks ago, we bought two more to replace those. One broke five minutes out of the box and the other just broke, tonight, after six weeks.
customer_reviews.author: SCF

customer_reviews.title: VERY DISAPPOINTED!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this is Feb of this year, I rely on a gripper because I am in an electric wheelchair and it helps me daily. This morning I went to pick up a SHIRT off the floor and the piece that picks things up I call them tongs...well the left one snapped right in half! I feel like once again I have thrown my money away on a gripper. This one was suppose to be so great and its no different than the others!
customer_reviews.author: ebeth

customer_reviews.title: Great job!
customer_reviews.text: I've had a "reacher" for many years but wanted another so I could have one on each floor. My Ettore arrived two days ago, I put it in the basement and kept my old one upstairs. This morning I took my old reacher outside to pick up my Sunday newspapers, and the papers fell right back onto the grass. I went inside and got the Ettore, which picked up the papers with no problem (even though the old reacher had a wider opening). I always thought one reacher would be just like another but apparently that is not true. The Ettore is now staying upstairs with me,and the old reacher is relegated to the basement.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine Granny

customer_reviews.title: Did not hold up.
customer_reviews.text: Used it several times and then the wire inside broke rendering it useless. Would not purchase again
customer_reviews.author: Ray R.

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the grabber i got at Walgreens
customer_reviews.text: I got the original grabber from Walgreens the "as seen on tv" one, this ones much better it will pick up individual pieces of paper off the floor or items like a full unopened coke can. its not as flimsy as the original either, ive already sent off for 2 more to give to my mother!
customer_reviews.author: Willa Wylde

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: does not pick up well it drops more then it pickup.
customer_reviews.author: LGG

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Although several reviewers said this is a piece of junk, that was not my experience at all. I used my recently purchased for several hours one day picking up many hundreds of pieces of some sort of debris that blew all over my lawn. This grabber works great from the time I started using it and absolutely no problems after hours of continuous use. And it pick things up fine. I did not pick up anything heavy, but it does seem to have good gripping power. Glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: BobL

customer_reviews.title: This seems to be good quality but I had a hard time keeping a ...
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be good quality but I had a hard time keeping a grip on jars in high cupboards. Jars would slip out.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Item broke quickly. The part that holds the grabber snapped.
customer_reviews.author: Butterflies

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely necessary.
customer_reviews.text: This product works great. I had a hip replacement ent and got a cheap grabber that came with my surgery kit. I immediately knew that it wouldn’t work well and bought this reacher. It’s a good length and is sturdy. I’ve picked up everything from garbage, clothing, my remote control and even a pumpkin seed from the floor. The only thing I couldn’t get without using my foot to manipulate it was my cell phone. Too slim to pick up. Oh and when I dropped my bar of soap I couldn’t get that either. Too slippery. Aside from that I don’t know what I would do without this product. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Conscious Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money on this product!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product 3 months ago and it already stopped functioning. The jaw opens but will not close. The product has had very light use. Unless they improve, it is a total waste of money. I gave it one star because there isn't anything less than one star.
customer_reviews.author: susan

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again, but...
customer_reviews.text: Very good grabber, IF you keep a close eye on the areas that it was designed to fail at. 1. Immediately put a hose clamp around the collar that lets the pincers swivel. 2. The trigger hinge pin wants to work out of place with regular use. I just push it back in as needed. 3. It's a little too long for our minivan, and a little too short for using on the riding mower. Perfect length in the house. Otherwise, it picks up nearly everything, saves my back, and is useful every day.
customer_reviews.author: Elisabeth Poe

customer_reviews.title: Love this product, but problem with one of three I've purchased
customer_reviews.text: I've had one of these grabbers that I've used continually for many years. It's the best there is. I have given several as gifts. One of two I bought in the recent past for gifts, however, broke after only a month or so of light use. The recipient said it snapped and can't be fixed. The other one I gifted is working perfectly. I have to think it was a fluke or user error with the broken one. Mine has been going strong for years. While I was disappointed that one of the grabbers broke, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend or buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Bunny

customer_reviews.title: Won't last
customer_reviews.text: I bought this is January of this year and the wire inside snapped at the beginning of March. Buyer beware.....if you plan on actually using it....It won't last.
customer_reviews.author: Lainnygirl

customer_reviews.title: Finally, a Grabber I can work with!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a couple grabbers and they wouldn't hold onto what I was trying to reach - especially at the grocery store. What an ordeal. This one is lightweight but substantial. It has a good grip and the grabber/gripper can pivot. You can easily pull on it gently and simply turn the head from N-S, to E-W. It's wonderful! Just don't sit on them. My 30 month old grandson brought my old one to me announcing that "it has a broken NECK!". I didn't mean to sit on it.
customer_reviews.author: MiaMadea

customer_reviews.title: Not good at picking up small or thin objrects.
customer_reviews.text: This grabber has very poor gripping ability. I am very disappointed with it. I have several other grabbers and they all work better than this one! I bought it to use when I use a lift chair. I often drop things like mail and it does not work in that type of situation. It may work better with larger items and I will experiment using it for a different type of task.
customer_reviews.author: stamper 82

customer_reviews.title: Functional for light weight items
customer_reviews.text: I bought this "Grip'n Grab" because I didn't want to get high up on a ladder to reach and pick avocado's. Well I was able to reach most of them using this grabber. There was only one trouble, every time I tried to pull the avocado or get it's stem to snap-off, this grabber would just slide off. It was very frustrating!!! Still once the avocado was on the ground, I was able to pick it up with this grabber. I wouldn't trust it to pick up off the ground anything heavier than an avocado. The rotating head is nice to be able to reach items that may have fallen between the washer and dryer or furniture pieces.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: Good for certain uses but beware using it for anything other than a can of Campbell’s soup.
customer_reviews.text: Get this if you want to use it for small jars or to pick up trash. I personally felt like whenever I tried to use it to get a pasta jar, it always felt like the jar was on the verge of falling out of grip. I returned this one and got lucky and found a Gopher at Walmart the same day. The gopher has suction cups which makes me much more confident that I won’t drop that jar of Ragu when I grab it with that.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Not functional
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a few weeks and just now got around to opening it up. Have never been unhappy with an Amazon order before but this one is terrible. The rubber on the tip is torn up and the Grabber will not close all the way so there is no way it's going to pick anything up. This one is going in the trash and I will go to a local store and pay more to get a decent one
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia M Davison

customer_reviews.title: Loved it until it broke ....
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item on 9/19/2016 and really liked it, I am temporarily handicapped post back surgery and need tool like this for dressing and many other daily activities. Unfortunately mine didn't make it to 90 days before it broke. During typical daily use it broke and is now useless. The cable broke where it connects to the trigger or handle. Very disappointing because up until then it worked great and appeared to be well made little device. There are no children in my residence and it was not abused, I hope I can find one that works as well and lives at least a year.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Very poor product
customer_reviews.text: Broke will not open and close very disappointed and I bought two Do not recommend this product Cable stretches and stops working
customer_reviews.author: James Brookshire

customer_reviews.title: This is grabber does not have a secure grip....It is Not returnable
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed with this grabber. BTW this item is NOT returnable. I'm 5'3 and I was looking for something that would help me get cans and bottles off of of the pantry shelves without grabbing a stool. It doesn't have a secure grip! When I tried to grab the item it falls through, over, or off of the shelves. I tried it with laundry and in my closet the handIe feels like its on backwards compared to the 3 other brands I purchased that have easier handles to use and secure grips. It does have a hole to hang it.
customer_reviews.author: artist

customer_reviews.title: If you’ve had hip replacement
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one of these over a year ago because I needed hip replacement. And have been using it ever since. I finally had my right hip replaced in June. This handy little grabber has been indispensable! I have dropped little pills, change, and all kinds of stuff. Picks it all up no problem. From tiny things to larger items like a full bottle of water. Heavier items to pick up just depends on your strength, but this little grabber is up to the task. If you have a hard time bending over or have had a hip replacement you need this grabber. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: M Willi

customer_reviews.title: Grip'n Grab's the Gold Standard
customer_reviews.text: The Grip'n Grab is amazing. I'm using it after back surgery. I never realized how much I drop things until I'm not supposed to bend. I regularly untie my shoes with it but when I dropped a couple quarters and picked them up with ease I was amazed. We had another brand we'd used for picking up cans but it was nearly wothless for picking up every little thing I drop. I did break one by trying to move a full 5 gal propane bottle, obvious abuse. Grip'n Grab is made by Ettore a company that makes professional window washing equipment and is very well made.
customer_reviews.author: M. Roper

customer_reviews.title: Good for grabbing things!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item prior to my surgery a few months ago, figuring that I'd be dropping everything on the floor afterwards and not be able to retrieve items. I've actually used it more afterwards. I've found it very handy to get canned goods off of top shelves, or to get that last sock out of the back of the dryer. I've not used it on anything heavier than an average-sized can of vegetables, so I really don't know how much weight it could hold. I found it very easy to use, and you don't have to grip the trigger very hard for the item to work. Seems to be well-made.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy R. Middendorf

customer_reviews.title: wow-so easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 Pik Stik brand picker uppers-one for outdoors and one for indoors and they often get "stuck" and difficult to use -this Ettore soo much easier to use and lighter weight than Pik S.-Thank you Amazon reviewers -I was planning to buy another Pik Stik for upstairs but because reviews so good I decided to try this one and glad I did!Only suggestion-put a hole on top-like PikStik -to hang up-just ordered Ettore shorter one
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I had bought one of these several years ago and it lasted 3 or 4 years and I loved it. It had good grip, it was sturdy, and could pick up the smallest of coins. I paid $32 for that one. This one was half that and it lasted 6 days
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: This is the best gripper I have found.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best gripper I have found. After a major abdominal surgery, this thing really cam through for the win. The trigger mechanism is light enough to avoid hand cramping or pain for an elderly buyer, but solid and strong enough to pick up an 8lb weight. I've had 3. (dog ate 1, lost another.) and this is the only gripper I will buy. I've tried a few other brands and styles. This one is the best in everything from picking things up to clamping strength.
customer_reviews.author: KM

customer_reviews.title: perfect trash mobilizer
customer_reviews.text: i pick up trash around my neighborhood on walks and this lil guy has had no trouble grabbing anything from smaller, penny sizes plastic wraps to large, half full drink bottles. the handle is comfy and the item itself isnt overly heavy even on long stints of picking things up. i like that it still has a good grip on light and heavy things and keeps me from bending over & straining my back. easy to clean with a little hose water if you need to! no complaints. :D
customer_reviews.author: Ava

customer_reviews.title: My favorite of three grabbers I purchased.
customer_reviews.text: Prior to knee surgery, I bought three grabbers because you can't have too much of a good thing. This was the first one I bought, followed by the Vive suction cup model and the Unger Grabber Plus. Of the three, this is my favorite. It is easy to work and hold items securely. Not only does it securely grab items and hold them, but just as importantly it releases the items when I want to release them, which is the issue I have with the Unger unit whose ridged rubber grips sometimes entangle with fabrics.
customer_reviews.author: wamaruna

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one 3 years ago, it picks up the smallest bit of fluff off of the floor, to gatorade bottles. I'll admit I did break the end (at the base of the grippers)when I tossed it out of the way and it smacked the window frame. So I bought a second one. Meanwhile I "mended the first one with popsicle sticks and self adherent cohesive bandage. (In blue) I can no longer adjust which direction the "jaws" go, but I haven't needed to. It still works awesomely and I haven't had to use the new one yet.
customer_reviews.author: Xaylem

customer_reviews.title: Best best best picker-upper ive purchased out of 5 or 6 different styles over the years
customer_reviews.text: The BEST design!! No suction but it doesn't matter a bit! The grab part is ALL rubber not just a little suction part. This allows for a secure handling of even glass objects... PLUS because the rubber is tapered to a dull point i can pick up ANY small object..coins, corn, nail even ICE (though the more melted the harder it is to grip) If you need to use grabber in everyday life then THIS IS THE ONE FOR YOU!
customer_reviews.author: Kaliena

customer_reviews.title: Excellent grabber.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my pregnant wife because it was becoming a bit uncomfortable for her to pick up after our toddler. The grip-n-grab works great. Has a strong sturdy grip with minimal squeezing pressure. I find myself using it quite a bit just about everyday for something. And as an added bonus my toddler likes to play with 'the machine' as well. The grabber jaws can rotate, which is handy, but I haven't found myself using that option very much. But at least you know it's there. Product feels durable as well. Very satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: lefthandedrighty

customer_reviews.title: Welcome Back, All Ye Lost Items!
customer_reviews.text: Works as promised. I have a big, heavy L-shaped desk with a full back, so when something falls between the desk and the wall, hopes of retrieving it are dashed. I had about a year's worth of miscellaneous items -- paper clip holder, pens, books, and important papers -- trapped behind my desk. This tool grabbed and retrieved them all within 10 minutes! Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Faraway Maine

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight handy tool
customer_reviews.text: I had back surgery which limited my ability to reach or bend to pick up items. This tool is lightweight and the grippers were able to pick up even a piece of fuzz or paper off my floor. I used it to reach for my clothing out of drawers or in the closet, getting laundry out of the washer and dryer. I am short and this little tool sure comes in handy almost daily.
customer_reviews.author: BeHappy

customer_reviews.title: First one was DOA
customer_reviews.text: Something was wrong with the first one I ordered. You could pull the trigger and the clamps would not close. But Amazon took care of it no problem. Always good Customer Service from them. I ordered another just like it and it works like a charm. I'm pleased with it and would recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: L. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Many uses! Make a short person happy!
customer_reviews.text: I am 5 Ft 2. Need I say more! This handy little tool is a lifesaver for me. Top shelves are no longer a problem! Getting socks out of the bottom of the washer is a breeze. So handy. I am thinking about getting another one. My dogs are scared of it. It came in real handy on Halloween when they kept trying to get out the door with the trick or treaters. I just stood at the door and showed it to them and they left the room!!
customer_reviews.author: Gala Louise Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Recommended Gripper Tool
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice grippers that would be handy for any homeowner. Sometimes it can be difficult to reach things that have fallen behind furniture or gotten stuck under something, and these grippers make it easy to reach things like that. And their rubber tips are so dexterous that they can pick up tiny objects (like dust bunnies) from the floor without having to stoop down. Well made and very handy, I recommend them to anyone in need of a gripper tool.
customer_reviews.author: Gary N. Shollenberger

customer_reviews.title: Great little grabber.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this so I can pick up the litter from the side of the road. I wish it was a little longer, so I can be lazy and not have to get up off the ATV, but as far as grabbing stuff goes, it has a nice grippy texture that picks up pretty much anything I've tried. Bottles, Styrofoam, paper, everything comes up first time. Really like it.
customer_reviews.author: tunafish

customer_reviews.title: Grabs things big and small --even dental floss!
customer_reviews.text: A little crazy but I purchased this to grab little pieces of paper etc.from the bottom of my trash and recycle bins that the garbage pickup leaves because the bins are too deep for me to reach. Works great and even grabbed a piece of dental floss! Easy grip, lightweight, picks up large and small. Length not adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: R. Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to squeeze  if you're  having a flare up of Rheumatoid  arthritis
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a quality built tool which is why I gave it 4 stars. Unfortunately when I ordered it I was having a a bad RA flare and had very limited strength in my hands. My hands were so weak I couldn't squeeze the handle. This us not the fault of the product as even if I could squeeze the handle any object I reached with it would have been too heavy at the time to lift. Bottom line : if you don't have good hand strength this won't work for you .
customer_reviews.author: Alyson P

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sturdy product
customer_reviews.text: Wow... so much better than that $10 deal at Walmart. This thing is sturdy and can pick up some heavy things. I had back surgery and bending was a no go and this got me through it. Plus its one dollar cheaper vs home depot in my area and with free shipping. Cant beat that
customer_reviews.author: Diana Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and will pick up a dime
customer_reviews.text: This Grip'n Grab Reach tool is exactly what my husband needed. He has had several back surgeries and it is very difficult for him to bend down to pick anything up, in fact it's just painful to watch him try. This handy tool has allowed him to go down to the beach and pick up debris after the winter storms which is a favorite pastime of his. I also feel better knowing that he isn't touching anything with his hands that might be toxic. The tool is super lightweight and will pick up a dime. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Waite

customer_reviews.title: Great grabber! the wire that links the trigger to the jaws stretches over time.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool. I use it to pick up trash that blows in around my property on occasion. It is strong enough to pick up a can of pop with ease but over time the wire linking the trigger to the jaws tends to stretch. Wish there was a better option but for now this is a great tool. I even bought a shorter one for my 3 year old (He loves to help me)
customer_reviews.author: Dko3030

customer_reviews.title: Best grabber hands down, shop no more.
customer_reviews.text: I thought the grabber they gave me when I was in therapy was the best out there. After using these for a month now, in no way shape or form is this worse than the 5 other different types of grabbers Iv ever used. This is hands down the best, easiest and life saving tool Iv ever used. Even my grandma is jealous and now wants me to order one since she's never seen a computer in her life. It grabs even the smallest of items such as a pin, a penny, a Popsicle stick. It grabs onto the thinnest of papers that can adhere to the floor and it can still pick it up.
customer_reviews.author: Antonia A. Furnari

customer_reviews.title: I bought four of these from different companies just to see which one I like the best
customer_reviews.text: This is a fellow up on the Ettore 49036 Grip'n Grab Reach Tool . This is a follow up on the Ettore Grip'n Grab Reach tool . I bought four of these from different companies just to see which one I like the best ,The Ettore 49036 Grip'n Grab Reach tool is by far the best I have used . It can pick up a paper clip or a dime off the floor or anything I need to reach . I highly recommend this reach and grab tool . Red
customer_reviews.author: Red

customer_reviews.title: not so hot
customer_reviews.text: hard to grab things ,they slip off the gripper end
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Geymann

customer_reviews.title: This is the second one I have bought because the first one has lasted so long now!
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these already that has lasted and lasted while the other brands I've had died in last than a year. I use these for picking up pecans that have fallen and other things at are where I need to grab something above me or in a hard to reach place. The head is adjustable and can be rotated.
customer_reviews.author: steves145

customer_reviews.title: good grabber
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my 88 year old mother who needed it for doing laundry. She has vertigo and this solves the problem of having to bend to pick up clothing from the basket. Very easy handle to use- easier to activate the handle than other grabbers that offer some resistance to squeeze the handle, especially if you have arthritis. It's solid and well built, but I did notice that the grabbing end is smaller than some other grabbers so this will limit the size of the items you can grab.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Best grabber our there!
customer_reviews.text: I read reviews from another product and someone recommended this one. I’m glad I listened! It is great! And the head turns. Is longer than most. And the grip won’t fail. We use it for toys behind the tv, clothes behind the dryer, and fallen toys under the under ground trampoline. So amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Derek & Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Similar Reachers I Have Used
customer_reviews.text: I really like that they don’t fold in the middle. I’ve had nothing but trouble with foldable reachers. It is easy to use. I don’t struggle trying to keep a hold of the item I’m reaching for (a big + for me). My only issue is, I wish the jaws opened a little wider. It won’t grab a roll of Select A Size Bounty Paper Towels - “Huge Size”. Other than that, I’m very pleased with this.
customer_reviews.author: The Real Grammy

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this product and highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Have used for 18 months around house and on the deck. I am 5' tall so have trouble reaching anything. Recent hip arthritis has now made bending over a challenge. This tool is versatile and handles high and low pick-ups with ease. Will purchase one for each level of my house soHig it's always handy. Very pleased with this product and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Carol P.

customer_reviews.title: A very useful tool!!!
customer_reviews.text: Everyone should have at least two of these in their home. I keep one near my kitchen for things that can be gotten from higher shelves, and I keep one in my closet for boots that I keep on higher shelves. It works GREAT!! I think they were invented for people who can't bend over to pick up off the floor, but they're fabulous all around the house!
customer_reviews.author: FY

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great for grabbing things on high shelves in the kitchen. It can even pick up a thin piece of paper from the floor. Very helpful tool. I have even used it in the laundry room to get small items out of my front loading washing machine that are too far back for me to reach by hand without straining myself.
customer_reviews.author: Buckeye67

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband who has back issues and trouble grasping small items due to several mini strokes. He loves it! He uses it for every thing from getting wet laundry out of the washer to picking up dropped pills from the floor. It is very sturdy and the rubber tips will let you pick up anything! Follow up - My husband loves this so much that we ordered a second one to keep in the bedroom so that he would always have one handy! Follow up #2 - Just bought our sixth Grip’n Grab. My husband broke one when he fell on it so he needed a replacement. Still love the product! We keep them everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Busy Homeschool Mom

customer_reviews.title: One of the best for routine garbage pickup
customer_reviews.text: Used every week for three hours picking up city trash. First one lasted a couple years, the second one a couple of months. The take home message - its still the best out there so I bought a thrid one. Very lightweight and ergonomic - important if using for more than 30 mins or so. The cable mechanism still fails over time, but it is the best of the three similar ones I have used. The design is a winning one, as many seem to have directly copied it, but the one clone I bought broke on the very first use. If you need one routinely like I do, buy the Ettore.
customer_reviews.author: Paul S.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE, LOVE
customer_reviews.text: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this tool! I am not able to bend over due to a medical issue. This grabber has been such a blessing to me! My family has enjoyed watching my excitement over being able to easily accomplish a variety of things that I couldn't easily do before. It even helps me with the straps on my sandals! The grabber is very well made. My family is amazed at how I can pick up the smallest of items with it, as well as larger items with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: TXCamper

customer_reviews.title: Very good grab tool
customer_reviews.text: We use these every day to open some shutters that are too high to reach without a step stool. With this grab tool I don't need get the step stool out every day to open the shutters and let the natural light into the house. They are also good to reach things under the bed or under a piece of furniture.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I have several grabbers. This one is the strong one. I had one, but was concerned with what I use it for outside, I would end up breaking it, so got a back up just in case. I pick up bricks, stone, etc. I am disabled due to a failed spine surgery and cannot bend - this has helped with so many outdoor projects!!
customer_reviews.author: Camilla J

customer_reviews.title: Works great for picking up tree debris in your yard
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to pick up fallen twigs and small branches before I mow my yard. I used to walk around pulling a rolling trash can and have to bend down to pick everything up, but decided to buy this grabber and give it a try. Works like a charm. I've used it to pick up everything from long sticks to a single leaf laying on the ground with no problems. It seems like it was built for more precise "indoor" grabbing, but so far it seems heavy duty enough for what I'm using it for.
customer_reviews.author: jimmy e.

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: I use this thing while riding my John Deere mower to pick up smaller branches that drop in my 1 acre front yard. I just drop them back into the dump trailer I tow behind and never have to leave my seat. The engine shuts off if you get off the mower seat so using this makes it much easier on the machine and on my back.
customer_reviews.author: Azbard

customer_reviews.title: Best Gripper I've Ever Bought
customer_reviews.text: Found my elderly mother using her gripper to tidy up her room in the nursing facility today. She loves them. They really do pick up even the smallest pieces of papers with ease. Mom drops a lot of tissues which grippers I've tried in the past can't pick up. Good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jude

customer_reviews.title: This is a good buy for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is the best thing I have for getting things on the top shelf that I can't reach. Who puts the stuff up there is curious but regardless, I can now reach the cookies! :-) The handle is good and there is a right turn you can make on the handle to be able to reach things on an angle. I found that the tool isn't very stable on heavier stuff and there are a few items that the grab can hold. However, given the price, this is a good buy. Now if I can just not have stuff on the top shelf....
customer_reviews.author: Dr. J

customer_reviews.title: Best one
customer_reviews.text: I've tried four different grabber products. This is the best. The amount of weight it will lift is limited by ones grip strength. Avoid twisting motions to get at something heavy - I broke a grabber hand that way. In all other ways, it works great. Picks up all kinds of things, large and small. I've picked up tiny things I never thought I'd be able to get. The construction feels more sturdy than others I tried.
customer_reviews.author: Blue

customer_reviews.title: The BEST!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered three different brands of grabbers when I place my order for this one . One is broken and tossed in the garbage, the other is useless, doesn't pick up hardly anything but it did have a magnet on the end so I use it in my craft room to pick up dropped pins and little wires. This one is by far the best. It picks up small and bigger items, will easily pick up soup cans, yet can pick up a piece of lint on the rug, I use it constantly throughout the day. definitely 5 stars!!
customer_reviews.author: Ginnie L. Olson

customer_reviews.title: Does light jobs and looks cheap - but not strong enough for heavier items
customer_reviews.text: I’ve recently had joint pain and I have always been short, so the two combined promoted my purchase. Unfortunately I don’t use this a lot because it wasn’t as expected. The extent that you have to clamp this with your hand is too painful, at least for me. The height is good, but unless you’re grabbing something the weight of a sock then I think this will hurt your hand and wrist. The construction of this looks cheaper than expected. It’ll do the job - if it’s light and you don’t care about it looking cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME! We organize trash pick-ups in our neighborhood
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME! We organize trash pick-ups in our neighborhood, and this picker rocks! It picks up the tiniest pieces of trash (corners of snack bags, cigarette nubs, etc), along with big cups and bottles. It's so nice not having to bend down. Also, the angle of the trigger you squeeze is great because you don't have to turn your wrist into awkward positions.
customer_reviews.author: Nairi

customer_reviews.title: Great for picking up trash
customer_reviews.text: I volunteer to pick up trash every week in my neighborhood with three other people. I have found the Ettore graber light, easy to use, and more deft at picking up small objects than my gloved hands. Grabbers my team mates use are heavier and don't grasp as well.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: I've had this one for several months now and I can't say enough good about it
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely ADORE this grabber! I have dysautonomia (I faint a lot) so bending over is a necessary evil when you've got 3 little ones. This has been a LIFE SAVER! I bought my first one about 2 years ago and thanks to an unruly 9 year old, it met an untimely demise. I've had this one for several months now and I can't say enough good about it. It will pick up just about anything and it has grips on the inside so things don't slip out. I will absolutely buy this again!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Wish price was lower
customer_reviews.text: Trouble is the the cable frays and sticks you hand. Sooner or later this happens. We have 4 of these
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Moore

customer_reviews.title: Not great.
customer_reviews.text: I don't like this one. It's grip is not great and you can't rotate the gripper.
customer_reviews.author: Cate Benish

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should
customer_reviews.text: Great for us older folks..... Great for picking up black walnuts (26 5-gallon buckets this past fall). Great for picking up small branches as I mow the lawn. No more stopping, getting off the tractor, picking up a stick and then getting back on.
customer_reviews.author: Yodobo

customer_reviews.title: Short person's key to independence
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. At first I was unsure if it could pick up small things because the end of the U-shape seem like they might close tight enough. But they do! They're rubbery so things don't slip from their grip. It is also helpful that the head pivots to help you reach into different spaces. I'm pretty short, and I've felt so much more independent now that I have this! It's easier than getting out the step ladder whenever I just need to reach one thing from a high shelf.
customer_reviews.author: Char King

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and.
customer_reviews.text: I am short and this item works great for me. It is even helpful to make the corner bed in our RV which is a struggle because the queen size bed is tucked in a three-wall area. I have one for the RV and I use one at home. Wouldn’t be without one!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Y.

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my monther-in-law who suffered hip fractures (both hips, one at a time, a month apart) earlier this year. Worked perfectly until someone "borrowed" it and I had to order another one. Very sturdy and easy to use. Superior to the style with "suction cups" on the end of flimsy metal which are barely capable of picking up a Kleenex tissue.
customer_reviews.author: Max H. Herr

customer_reviews.title: Good grasping and dexterity but poor durability.
customer_reviews.text: I originally loved these graspers when they arrived and was using them for my freshwater aquarium, however after a few months of use, the entire grasping mechanism stopped working, and they are now useless. The description states they are rustproof and ok to use in ponds, but for whatever reason, the grippers don't last, at least when utilized for my fish tank.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: Currently using crutches to get around and needed grabbers to pickup small items off the floor. This grabber works well, is light weight, and has good grabbing ability. I like the 90deg rotation option as well. I am purchasing a couple more, 1 to keep upstairs, and 1 for the office.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph T.

customer_reviews.title: It does the job it is supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: I just wish it opened up a little more and was a little stronger, but it does what it is supposed to do. They should make a more industrial strength version because not all things out of reach of a short person are light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Mark/Sandy Powers

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: I had back surgery two weeks ago and bought this a few days before because I am not supposed to be bending for awhile. I can't believe how great this thing works, I am amazed!! I dropped a tiny pill and it picked it up first try! I have actually had fun using it to pick up around the house as I have been bored to tears. My 3 & 4 yo granddaughters have been playing with it a lot and I was a little worried they may break it but it has stood up to them. I am a nurse case manager and will be suggesting all my patients purchase this before they have surgery.
customer_reviews.author: Debra F.

customer_reviews.title: Second one for me.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these i bought. Bought this for a friend. The first one I bought when i hard my knees replaced and it keeps on working. Strong enough to pick up some heavy items. Then not break when i squeeze it hard.
customer_reviews.author: Richardj

customer_reviews.title: VERY Happy with this one!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this one and another "2-Pack" from someone else at the same time. This one is sturdy and strong. I was easily able to pick up a piece of paper off of my tile floor. The rubber like ends gives it grip. The other one arrived 'alone' and bent. I'm going to order another one of these.
customer_reviews.author: R W

customer_reviews.title: Decent grabber to pick up small items
customer_reviews.text: Good for grabbing lightweight items. The strength of the grip is not the best, but I use it to reach things that have fallen between our couch and the wall and it works great for that purpose. Most of the items are small toys, remote controls or books. I wouldn't use it to try to grab things much heavier than that.
customer_reviews.author: Erin R.

customer_reviews.title: Grip'n Grab is  definitely the best reaching/grab device
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in 2014 and I am still using it with almost 100% success. It picks up the many itens my arthritic habds drop~ hairbrush, tv remote, clothing, magazine, pill bottles, even picks up small pills! l have purchased for friends and relatives who all report great success.I have also bought a few DIFFERENT brands because I wanted a horter reach. All terrible! Difficult to grip and squeeze or the gripping component limits what can be picked up-- can't even open enough to grab a typical bottle of vitamins. Just received this a 2 pack Royal Medical device from Amazon-- the worst I have seen! If only Grip'nGrab had a 20'--24 inch device!!
customer_reviews.author: Sara Greene

customer_reviews.title: Best Reacher I've used so far.
customer_reviews.text: I've introduced/demoed this reacher to my patients at Rehab. They all want one. ( I direct them to Amazon) I've used a few and this has a great rubber grip that can help get items that are out of reach like cans off shelves as well as being able pick up items that have dropped on the floor under the couch, even pieces of paper. I encourage people to have more than one for the rooms they need it in.... or velcro them onto their walkers if they use one. Sturdier than others on the market and has many uses. I highly recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Sultana

customer_reviews.title: Works as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: This has worked exactly as I needed it to. I have a difficult time reaching behind my washer and dryer when clothes fall back there. I've also used it to pick things up that fall over the edge of our deck. It has done it's job well. We also use it to play with the cats (picking up their toys and such).
customer_reviews.author: JLJohnson01

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: While I haven’t tried every grabber out there I can still stay this is at the top of it’s grabbing game. It’s built like a tank yet still light in weight. It grabs with great strength the tips allow you to pick up the tiniest of items. I’d say perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Father Of Pugs

customer_reviews.title: Back Surgery Recovery
customer_reviews.text: Once I was cleared to do so medically, I used this to avoid bending while recovering from back surgery. Although somewhat tedious, I was able to do my own laundry by moving one piece at a time, but then for a few weeks I had plenty of time. Obviously very convenient if I dropped something as well. I also did not need to reach for things, allowing for a good recovery.
customer_reviews.author: src

customer_reviews.title: Ettore 49036 Grip'n Grab Reach Tool, 32-Inch
customer_reviews.text: I really like this grab stick/reacher. It's lightweight but still surprisingly strong. I can pick up a heavy sneaker from the floor, grab it securely and lift it without the reacher bending or bowing in the least. The soft rubber which lines the inside surface of the grabber does help get a better grab on certain items. The rubber grip on the handle is also a real plus. I would definitely buy again. One of the best grabbers I've purchased to date (and I've bought several!).
customer_reviews.author: JinglepawsTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Not very strong
customer_reviews.text: This looks and works like it was advertised, BUT it is not strong enough to grab most things I need it to get for me. Couldn't get a box of cereal couldn't get a loaf of bread, definitely could not get a can of soup. Rip-off
customer_reviews.author: Grammy

customer_reviews.title: I Love This "Grabber"
customer_reviews.text: I am short. That is a big problem when you can't reach things in your kitchen cabinets. I needed something to help me get items from high shelves. I had a dollar store reacher but it wasn't strong enough to do the job and I struggled with it constantly. I looked at all the products available on Amazon and settled on this Ettore one. It is sturdy, strong and easily maneuverable. I can successfully reach and retrieve canned goods and other items on high shelves. Another great use for this item is picking up sticks from my yard so I don't have to bend over. I am a satisfied customer.
customer_reviews.author: Sweetshrub

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to help me grab things off the top of the cabinets. My family thinks I'm taller than I really am! LOL Now I don't need to drag the little ladder out to get stuff off the top shelves and top of the cabinets.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a broken folding model. This one is much sturdier. Great for us vertically challenged folks AND when is had shoulder surgery. I even incorporate this with my at home physical therapy.
customer_reviews.author: tommy

customer_reviews.title: Great tool to keep from having to bend over a lot
customer_reviews.text: I used this to cleanup tree sticks, cones and other debris from my yard. It works perfectly for this chore and certainly is a back saver by not having to constantly bend to pick up debris. I only wished I had bought one of these years ago and I certainly will buy again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Charles spell

customer_reviews.title: Helps a ton
customer_reviews.text: This tool helped me a whole lot especially when I had my surgery. I wasn't able to bend as much so I used this product to help pick up things off the floor like my toddler's toys, clothes, food, etc. I'm also short so it helps me pick up things from atop of the cabinets or the clothes from the bottom of the washing machine drum.
customer_reviews.author: Anne V.

customer_reviews.title: Best reacher/picker upper on the market
customer_reviews.text: Strongest reacher/picker upper on the market. As long as you don’t pick up something too heavy, it will last you a good while. I buy several at a time so when the day finally comes for one to retire I have another on hand. Great for reaching clothes out of washing machine or dryer . Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Debra M. Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Reputable company, just a bad product.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 to start with. 3 of the 4 broke within the first week. I contacted the company and they sent 3 more to replace them. All 7 of these broke within 2 weeks of using them. The product is bad but the company tried very hard to make me happy. They finally sent 2 more and refunded all my money with no problems. The last 2 lasted 4 days.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Urness

customer_reviews.title: Using for 5 years now
customer_reviews.text: I have had this grip n go for 5 years now and it is still going strong. I ordered several different types of these tools for picking up trash on our property along a busy road and this one is by far the best. The mechanism can pick up very small items, you do not have to squeeze hard and it is lightweight. I am ordering another to have as a back-up for when/if this one does fail as well as purchasing two for my neighbors. It makes the somewhat gross task of picking up garbage so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Kinsman

product_meta.title: Ettore Grip'n Grab: Multi-Purpose Reach Tool with Rotating Rubber Grip Head
product_meta.description: Size:32 Inch ReachMulti-purpose pick-up and clean-up tool is great for use in the home and around the yard. Also provides help for the physically disabled. Comfortable handle and rubberized jaws allow for easy retrieval of objects high and low. Say goodbye to hand, arm, back or knee strain when you extend your reach with the Grip'n Grab. Recommended for lifting items up to 5 pounds.
feature_bullets: Multi-purpose pick up and clean tool is great for inside and outside a home; rust-proof
Features lightweight aluminum and plastic construction for sleek profile that reaches into tight spaces
Articulation head turns 90 degree; its versatility can pick up object high or low without bending or straining
Comfort grip reduces repetitive motion fatigue and rubberized jaws securely holds up to 5 pounds

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars5,786 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
